command: $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $pscp='pscp.exe'; $log="$env:ProgramData\NetAdmin\logs\T1597.log"; $host='sftp.fsisac.com'; $user=$env:FSISAC_USER; $key=$env:FSISAC_PPK; $hostkey=$env:FSISAC_HOSTKEY; $remote='/members/intel/daily/fsisac-intel-2025-09-30.json'; $dest='C:\Intel\FSISAC\fsisac-intel-2025-09-30.json'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $dest) -Force | Out-Null; try { & $pscp -scp -batch -q -C -P 22 -i $key -hostkey $hostkey "$user@$host:$remote" "$dest"; if($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0){ throw "pscp exit code $LASTEXITCODE" }; $hash=(Get-FileHash -Algorithm SHA256 -Path $dest).Hash; $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; sha256=$hash; success=$true; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } catch { $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; success=$false; error=$_.Exception.Message; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } finally { $json=$status|ConvertTo-Json -Compress; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $log) -Force | Out-Null; Add-Content -Path $log -Value $json; Write-Output $json }
explanation: Fetches member-only FS-ISAC intelligence JSON via SCP with key authentication and logs a structured JSON status entry.
rationale_steps: Use authenticated access to a closed member community feed.
Transfer a specific daily file in a non-interactive, quiet manner.
Verify integrity and record an acquisition log for compliance.
Adheres to closed-source reconnaissance without delivery or execution.
